briefTitle: Retention in HIV Care for Hispanic Immigrants
officialTitle: Addressing Barriers to Retention in HIV Care for Hispanic Immigrants

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age 18 years or older and able to communicate in Spanish or English
* Born in Puerto Rico or Spanish-speaking Latin American country
* HIV-infected or HIV-positive
* New HIV diagnosis or unable to regularly attend HIV primary care appointments

Exclusion Criteria:

* Unable to provide verbal consent due to unstable medical or psychiatric condition

primary.description: A dichotomized outcome (yes/no) with yes defined as at least one visit to HIV clinic at both time periods (week 1-16 and week 17-32), and no defined as no HIV visit from at least one time period. Responses determined by review of the medical record for evidence of attended HIV clinic visits.

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With HIV Viral Load Suppression up to Week-24
secondary.description: Participants with HIV viral load \<200 copies/ml

secondary.measure: Change in CD4 T-cell Count Over 24 Weeks
secondary.description: Change in CD4 T-cell count from baseline to week-24 post-randomization

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With HIV Viral Load Suppression up to 48 Weeks.
secondary.description: Number of participants with HIV RNA \<200 copies/ml

secondary.measure: Change in CD4 T-cell Count Over 48 Weeks.
secondary.description: Change in CD4 T-cell count from baseline to week-48 post-randomization
